source.name: Final challenge
source.instructions:
Observe the files`index.html` and `style.css` in the top left pane as well as the visual result underneath it.

You are asked to add styles in `style.css` :
1) In `#header-nav` , on the items "Article 1" and "Article 2" put a font-size of 80%.

2) On `#footer-nav` put a font-size of 60% and a padding-left of 0px.

3) On the `h1` with class `small` put a font-size of 70%.

You are allowed exactly 3 CSS rules for that. 
You are not allowed to modify the HTML file.

Good luck !

source.name: Simplifying the classes
source.instructions:
Now a little challenge to check your understanding on the concept of multiple classes : Have a look at the `index.html` code on the left, as well as the code of the `style.css` You will see that there are many classes declared in the CSS like `.normal-orange-right` or `.big-blue-left` ... You are asked to simplify all this and use multiple classes in the HTML and CSS (like in section 5). Every class should have one function and you should use multiple classes on the `

` in the html. The end result must be exactly the same as now (see left bottom window for the preview) And here is a screenshot of it just in case : ![](.guides/img/illu3.png) Good luck !

source.name: Combining rules
source.instructions: In the file `withoutclasses.html` in the bottom left pane : You have to add a single CSS selector that will target both the `h1` and `h2` and make them both bold. Then create another single selector that will target both the `h2` and `p` and give them a color that is 'gray'. Good luck !

source.name: Fix our page
Work with ids
source.instructions:
Underneath the `ul` with `id=nav` in the top left file called `example.html` :
- Add a `p` with `id="content"` and put some text in it.
- Underneath it, add another `p` with `id="footer"` and put some text in it.

Now, using CSS target the `p` with `id="footer"` and apply this style to it :

```css
color:gray;
font-size:80%;
```
Don't forget to check the result in the preview.
Good luck !

source.name: Class or ID ?
source.instructions:
Have a look at the `challenge.html` file on the top left.
It has a whole HTML structure created for you.

Please assign to the tags the following IDs and classes in a way that makes sense :
1) `id="navigation"`
2) `class="current"`
3) `class="hightlighted"`

Think about the function of each element and read the texts, that might help !

Good luck !

source.name: Our quote example
source.instructions:
On the left we have two files called `index.html` and `style.css` opened. On the bottom you have a preview of `index.html`.

You will see that there are 3 paragraphs. We ask you to make the second paragraph stand out as a quote. For that you will have to add a class called `quote` to the style.css file and to apply it to the second paragraph.

The quote class should have :
A font size of `1.2em`
A background color of `#f9f9f9`
A border on the left of `10px solid #cccccc`
A padding value of `10px`

Don't forget to refresh your preview to see if everything works well!
Good luck !
